details.title: Spacecraft Attitude Measurement Using Spatial Coherence of Laser or Star Light
details.abstract: A new method of measuring the attitude of spacecraft with respect to a reference beam of laser light or star light is described. The method uses the spatial coherence property of these beams and provides accuracies of Â± 0.01 second of arc or greater. After giving a general description of the method, the feasibility of constructing such systems using presently available lasers and detectors is established. Finally, some aspects of the detection equipment are examined in detail.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
